@RiddlerA: I just tried watching your 'Salt' rip before I found that it included the 'Cinavia' audio DRM trigger, which makes it unplayable on updated PS3's or new Blu-Ray players. This DRM is going to be standard across all Blu-Ray movies.

It is fairly easy to eliminate, but it can be a bit more expensive and time-consuming. Using the audio from the DVD version removes the DRM. Is it possible for you to do this? Your rips have been my primary source of movies for the last few months, but this DRM means I can't watch it on my TV, and it's pretty lousy to have that limitation.

@unique223 - try using TVersity media server and stream the movie or u can convert the file using mkv2vob (PS3 video converter) takes 5 minutes
